meanings.definition: Bolsterers: people who support or strengthen something
meanings.sent1: The bolsterers at the charity event worked tirelessly to raise funds for the cause.
meanings.sent2: The team of bolsterers helped the injured hiker safely make it down the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The bolsterers at the bake sale were like a superhero squad, ensuring every treat was sold.
meanings.sent4: The community members acted as bolsterers, lifting up the spirits of those in need.
meanings.sent5: In times of crisis, the bolsterers emerge as beacons of hope and strength.

meanings.definition: Bolsterers: things that provide support or reinforcement
meanings.sent1: The pillows served as comfortable bolsterers for the tired travelers on the long journey.
meanings.sent2: The extra beams in the building acted as bolsterers, ensuring its stability during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy clouds in the sky seemed like natural bolsterers for the sun, keeping it shining brightly.
meanings.sent4: The thick walls of the fortress stood as formidable bolsterers against any enemy attack.
meanings.sent5: The strong roots of the tree served as reliable bolsterers, anchoring it firmly in the ground.
